metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Displaying XML
Raw XML files can be viewed in all major browsers.
content.html: Raw XML files can be viewed in all major browsers.

content.text: Don't expect XML files to be displayed as HTML pages.
content.html: Don't expect XML files to be displayed as HTML pages.

content.text: Viewing XML Files

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

- <note>

<to>Tove</to>

<from>Jani</from>

<heading>Reminder</heading>

<body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>

</note>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
- <note>
  <to>Tove</to>
  <from>Jani</from>
  <heading>Reminder</heading>
  <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>

content.text: Look at the XML file above in your browser: note.xml
content.html: Look at the XML file above in your browser: note.xml

content.text: Most browsers will display an XML document with color-coded elements.
content.html: Most browsers will display an XML document with color-coded elements.

content.text: Often a plus (+) or minus sign (-) to the left of the elements can be clicked to expand or collapse the element structure.
content.html: Often a plus (+) or minus sign (-) to the left of the elements can be clicked to expand or collapse the element structure.

content.text: To view raw XML source, try to select "View Page Source" or "View Source" from the browser menu.
content.html: To view raw XML source, try to select "View Page Source" or "View Source" from the browser menu.

content.text: Note: In Safari 5 (and earlier), only the element text will be displayed. To view the raw XML, you must right click the page and select "View Source".
content.html: Note: In Safari 5 (and earlier), only the element text will be displayed. To view the raw XML, you must right click the page and select "View Source".

content.text: Viewing an Invalid XML File
If an erroneous XML file is opened, some browsers will report the error, and some will display it, or display it incorrectly.
content.html: If an erroneous XML file is opened, some browsers will report the error, and some will display it, or display it incorrectly.

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

- <note>

<to>Tove</to>

<From>Jani</from>

<heading>Reminder</heading>

<body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>

</note>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
- <note>
  <to>Tove</to>
  <From>Jani</from>
  <heading>Reminder</heading>
  <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>

content.text: Try to open the following XML file: note_error.xml
content.html: Try to open the following XML file: note_error.xml

content.text: Other XML Examples
Viewing some XML documents will help you get the XML feeling:
content.html: Viewing some XML documents will help you get the XML feeling:

content.text: An XML breakfast menu This is a breakfast food menu from a restaurant, stored as XML.
content.html:
An XML breakfast menu
This is a breakfast food menu from a restaurant, stored as XML.

content.text: An XML CD catalog This is a CD collection, stored as XML.
content.html:
An XML CD catalog
This is a CD collection, stored as XML.

content.text: An XML plant catalog This is a plant catalog from a plant shop, stored as XML.
content.html:
An XML plant catalog
This is a plant catalog from a plant shop, stored as XML.

content.text: Why Does XML Display Like This?
XML documents do not carry information about how to display the data.
content.html: XML documents do not carry information about how to display the data.

content.text: Since XML tags are "invented" by the author of the XML document, browsers do not know if a tag like <table> describes an HTML table or a dining table.
content.html: Since XML tags are "invented" by the author of the XML document, browsers do not know if a tag like <table> describes an HTML table or a dining table.

content.text: Without any information about how to display the data, the browsers can just display the XML document as it is.
content.html: Without any information about how to display the data, the browsers can just display the XML document as it is.

content.text: Tip: If you want to style an XML document, use XSLT .
content.html: Tip: If you want to style an XML document, use XSLT.
